title: Competition watchdog to examine Amazon investment in Deliveroo
text:
The UK's competition watchdog has launched a probe into Amazon's investment in Deliveroo, prompting concerns over the British company's dwindling cash pile.

Amazon had led a $575m (£470m) funding round into Deliveroo in May, but was later told to pause the investment, as the Competition and Markets Authority had “reasonable grounds” to believe that Amazon and Deliveroo had either already ceased to be separate businesses, or would merge in the future.

Although the tie-up between the pair involved Amazon becoming a minority shareholder in Deliveroo, the CMA signalled that arrangements between the pair which were in "progress or in contemplation" would see them combined.

Amazon does not offer its own takeaway delivery service in the UK after Amazon closed it last year.

It has, however, been bulking up its grocery delivery services, and it is thought the deal could help Amazon improve its delivery capability, given Deliveroo's focus has been on making sure customers can get their food within shorter timeframes and to most locations.

Amazon had previously made approaches for Deliveroo.

The CMA said it would start work on an initial investigation tomorrow, and would be making a decision over whether to refer it for an in-depth probe before Dec 11.
description: The UK's competition watchdog has launched a probe into Amazon's investment in Deliveroo, prompting concerns over the British company's dwindling cash pile.
